item.title: What's So Great About the Cloverfield Paradox?
item.description: Nothing, but it could have been worse. Actually, I got bored and didn't watch it all. I'm writing about it here because there were a couple of things I liked. I'll tell you about those shortly. First, disclaimer: I didn't watch any of the Cloverfield series. They must have been good though, because they made a lot of money. The box office from the first one, "Cloverfield," released in 2008, something like tripled cost.

item.title: Music Playlist Feature - Le Tigre
item.description: The "Le Tigre" sound is uniquely cacophonous, punky, and at the same time invigoratingly rebellious. It's also distinct from their usurp-tuous message, which is somewhat synonymous with that of those rebellious femmes "Pussy Riot". Blended between, and around, their radically satirical bathroom-stall lyrics are a rather impressive display of clever and cantankerously harmonious notes. What they've done here is nothing less than brilliant. They've served up a deliciously tangy earful that's not bad to listen to every once in awhile.

item.title: Hello Music Playlist - Music You Can Work To
item.description: Preamble There's a lot of good music made for television streams these days. I typically work in silence, but With this stuff I can play low-volume background music and get still get a lot done.

item.title: Hello Music Playlist
item.description: Preamble There's not a lot of time to sort unstructured music archives. Take what you find here and have fun with it. Stuff to listen to while contemplating the work you have to do Stuff to listen to after stuffing yourself Stuff to listen to on the exercise bike

item.title: Hello Music Playlist - Saki Kaskas
item.description: Preamble I knew Saki through my highschool gang's band Omnibol. He was straight-up, humble, and authentic - and he had a monster talent. Didn't see him around much over the years but when I did we'd gel. Rest In Peace Saki.
